intro: Ludwigia peploides var. glabrescens, commonly known as the smooth ludwigia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its dense, compact growth habit. The plant typically features small, oval leaves and produces vibrant yellow-orange flowers. It thrives in wetland environments and is often found in marshes and along the edges of ponds. This species is valued in aquatic horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to provide habitat for aquatic life.
